Our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting networking in our AMS and FRA regions. During this time, users may experience intermittent packet loss or increased latency while interacting with the resources in these regions.

At the moment, all Droplet-based services appear to be impacted and users can expect to see brief connectivity issues and interrupted traffic flows.  We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

incidents.name: Multiple services down and API availability

incident_updates.body:
Our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting Public API and multiple services has been fully resolved. 

Users should no longer experience issues with Billing services, new User registrations, and Droplet event processing. All services related to the App platform, Managed Kubernetes, Container Registry, and Block Storage Volumes should be functioning normally.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering team had already deployed a fix earlier and that has mitigated the issue impacting Public API and multiple services. 

As of 09:20 UTC, our Engineering team found issues related to Billing services which have been mitigated as well after a fix was deployed. 

As of now, users should no longer experience issues with new User registrations and Droplet event processing. All services related to the App platform, Managed Kubernetes, DigitalOcean Container Registry, and Block Storage Volumes should be functioning normally at this time.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

As of 06:48 UTC, our Engineering team confirmed that the fix applied has mitigated the issue impacting Public API and multiple services.
 
Users should no longer experience issues with new user registrations, Droplet event processing, App platform, Managed Kubernetes, Container Registry, and Block Storage Volumes. We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

As of 05:22 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting our API and Droplets.
During this time, users may experience errors when trying to use the public API at api.digitalocean.com, when attempting to create new user registrations, and may see issues with processing Droplet events.

We are now confirming the full impact, but users may also notice problems with other services. We regret any inconvenience and will let you know as soon as more information is available

Our engineering team has resolved the issue impacting Spaces in our NYC3 region. From approximately 3:41 UTC - 5:10 UTC, users may have encountered errors with API or object requests, experienced difficulties in creating new buckets in NYC3, or faced issues with loading Spaces in the Cloud Control Panel. Spaces should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with Spaces availability in our NYC3 region and is actively working on a fix. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

As of 03:15 UTC, Our Engineering team is investigating a drop in the availability for Spaces in our NYC region. During this time, some users may experience errors with API or object requests, be unable to create new buckets in NYC3, and/or see issues with loading Spaces in the Cloud Control Panel. 

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

Our vendor has confirmed resolution of this issue and the Support Center is functioning normally as of approximately 11:00 UTC. 

Users can access the Support Center and submit tickets normally. We appreciate your patience as we worked through this issue and apologize for the disruption. 

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from the contact form.

Our Engineering team has confirmed with our vendor that the Support Center is accessible once more. At this time, users should be able to access the Support Center normally through their DigitalOcean account. 

Our team and the vendor are continuing to monitor this issue. We will post further updates as we have new information or once we confirm this issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team has received updates from our vendor and continues to work with them to resolve the issue with accessing our Support Center.

Unfortunately, at this time, we are unsure when the Support Center will be fully accessible again. We expect users to be unable to access it for at least the next 12 hours. We will provide another update once we have further information, or by 15:00 UTC on June 29. 

We understand how disruptive it is when users are not able to reach Support through their accounts and apologize for the disruption. Please reach out to our Support team if you need assistance via our contact form: https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

Our Engineering team continues to work with our vendor in order to resolve the issue with users accessing the Support Center through their cloud account or directly from https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/s/. The issue has been escalated and we are awaiting feedback. 

As a reminder, if users need to reach out, they can utilize https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

Our vendor has noted remediation of the issue on their side and our Support team is now able to access customer support queries and respond normally. 

However, our Engineering team is still seeing an issue with our Support Center at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/s/ and is reaching out to our vendor for additional assistance. Users are unable to submit queries through their DigitalOcean account or directly from the URL above. 

In the meantime, if users need to reach the Support team, they can use https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support. 
We invite any users with Premium Support Plans to reach out via Slack for assistance as well.

Our Engineering team has confirmed this incident is the result of an issue with our Support Center vendor. We are closely monitoring their reported issue. 

As they work to remediate the situation, errors may become intermittent. Our Support team is working to address any support queries as they can. 

We'll provide another update as soon as we know more.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with the Support Center. Based on the impact we are seeing, we believe this error is originating with our upstream provider and are working to confirm. 

During this time, the Support Center is unavailable for customers to create tickets through Cloud Support Page, and replies from our Support team will be delayed. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 18:36 UTC, GitHub has recovered and is operating normally. App Platform users with source code hosted in GitHub should no longer experience any errors while deploying their Apps.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

As of 17:52 UTC, our App Platform service might experience errors due to an ongoing GitHub incident. During this time, App Platform users with source code hosted in GitHub will have their App builds failed and users will not be able to create new Apps based on GitHub sources. Additionally, users who reference GitHub source code amongst their dependencies may see those dependencies fail to fetch.

Please visit the below link for more information on the GitHub incident.
https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/gqx5l06jjxhp

We're monitoring Github's incident and will post any relevant updates here.

As of 15:31 UTC our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting Networking in AMS3 region has been fully resolved.

From 07:40 UTC to 15:31 UTC, Users may have experienced network timeouts, packet loss, and/or increased latency interacting with the resources in the AMS3 region. The impact has been completely subsided and the network connectivity is back to normal for all the services in AMS3 region. 

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

The network issues affecting our AMS3 region have been mitigated. Users should no longer experience packet loss/latency, timeouts, and related issues with Droplet-based services in those regions, including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database. 

We will continue to monitor network conditions for a period of time to establish a return to pre-incident conditions.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting the networking in our AMS3 region. During this time, a subset of users may experience intermittent packet loss or increased latency while interacting with the resources in AMS3 region.

At the moment, all the droplet-based services appear to be impacted and the users can expect to see brief connectivity issues and interrupted traffic flows. This will also be impacting services including Spaces, Managed Kubernetes and Managed Databases as well. 

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.
